H0.text: Aristotle developed a classification system that divided living things into several groups that we still use today, including mammals, insects, and reptiles.

H1.text: Jung is the person who developed a classification system that divided living things into several groups that we still use today, including mammals, insects, and reptiles.

H2.text: Darwin developed a classification system that divided living things into several groups that we still use today, including mammals, insects, and reptiles.

H3.text: Harrold developed a classification system that divided living things into several groups that we still use today, including mammals, insects, and reptiles.

A4.text: Aristotle grouped what a zoologist would call vertebrates as 'animals with blood', and invertebrates as 'animals without blood'. Those with blood were divided into live-bearing (mammals), and egg-laying (birds, reptiles, fish).
